page.title: 08PARISH OF TIBBERMORE (1)
page.content: The parish of Tibbermore lies a few miles west of Perth and forms part of the Strath of Earn, 'strath' being a Scots word meaning valley. The Earn valley, together with Strathmore, forms two of the most important agricultural areas in Scotland. We visited a typical farm, Loanleven, and we looked at the farm buildings. The farmhouse was very large and commands a beautiful view over fertile fields to the Ochil hills. We were shown the large barn, brick built with a semi-circular corrugated asbestos roof. It measured about one hundred feet by forty feet and housed the two huge combine harvesters, together with hundreds of bales of straw.
